intro: Senecio clavifolius, commonly known as the yellow owl's clover, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive yellowish-green color. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio clavifolius is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
